title: Can the Enteric Nervous System Impact Human Health and Emotions More Than Previously Thought?
first_phrase: Neuro-gastroenterological studies suggest that the enteric nervous system (ENS) and the brain-gut axis (BGA) may play a profound role in human physiological and psychological operation. The ENS is far more complex and independent than previously thought and communicates with the central nervous system (CNS) via the BGA. Interestingly, the ENS affects mood and emotional well-being, suggesting that the role of the ENS in human health is stronger than previously thought.
